revision.comment: remove extraneous spaces at end of line
revision.text: ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Etymology=== From the name of the {{w|River Yare}} + {{der|en|ang|mūþ||mouth}}. The town in Nova Scotia is named after the town in Massachusetts. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/ˈjɑː(ɹ).məθ/}} * {{hyphenation|en|Yar|mouth}} * {{rhymes|en|ɑɹməθ|s=2}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun|~|s}} # {{lb|en|uncountable}} A [[placename]]: ## {{short for|en|Great Yarmouth|nodot=1}}, [[Norfolk]]. ## {{place|en|town/and/civil parish|with a town council on the northwest coast of the|co/Isle of Wight|cc/England}} {{q|[[OS]] grid ref SZ3589}}. ## {{place|en|town|in southwestern|p/Nova Scotia|c/Canada}}. ## {{place|en|unincorporated community|co/Des Moines County|s/Iowa|c/US}}. ## {{place|en|town|co/Cumberland County|s/Maine|c/US}}. ## {{place|en|town|co/Barnstable County|s/Massachusetts|c/US}}. # {{lb|en|countable}} {{surname|en|[[habitational]]|from=Old English}}. ====Statistics==== * According to data collected by Forebears in 2014, ''Yarmouth'' is the 557260<sup>th</sup> most common surname in the United States, belonging to 22 individuals. ====Derived terms==== {{der3|en|District of Yarmouth|Great Yarmouth|Yarmouth capon|Yarmouth County}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:en:DAFN}} * {{R:en:Forebears|yarmouth}} ===References=== * [https://epns.nottingham.ac.uk/browse/id/532869e6b47fc40bab000e28-Yarmouth Survey of English Place-Names]
